SEARCH
Package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics

Class IndexingAdapter<E>

java.lang.Object
org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.IndexingAdapter<E>
Type Parameters:
E - element type of the backing list
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<List<E>>
public final class IndexingAdapter<E> extends Object implements Iterable<List<E>>
Adapts an Iterable<int[]> of index tuples to an Iterable<List<E>> of element tuples, using a provided List<E> as the backing source.

What problem does this solve?

The combinatorics generators in this package (e.g., Combinations, Permutations) produce tuples of indices into a conceptual domain {0..n-1}. In many real uses, you have an actual list of elements (names, cards, objects) and you want the tuples of elements directly. IndexingAdapter bridges that gap: 


 List<String> names = List.of("Ada", "Grace", "Edsger", "Barbara");
 Iterable<int[]> pairsOfIndices = new Combinations(2, names.size());

 for (List<String> pair : new IndexingAdapter<>(pairsOfIndices, names)) {
     System.out.println(pair); // e.g., [Ada, Grace], [Ada, Edsger], ...
 }

Design

  • Lazily maps each int[] tuple to a new unmodifiable List<E> of the same length.
  • Per-tuple bounds checking: each index must satisfy 0 <= i < source.size().
  • Does not copy the source list; only builds a new result list per emitted tuple.

Complexity

  • Time per tuple: O(k) to build the List<E> of length k.
  • Space per tuple: O(k) for the result list (returned to the caller).

Example with permutations


 List<Integer> nums = List.of(10, 20, 30);
 for (List<Integer> p : new IndexingAdapter<>(new Permutations(2, nums.size()), nums)) {
     System.out.println(p); // e.g., [10, 20], [10, 30], [20, 10], ...
 }
Since:
0.1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • IndexingAdapter

      public IndexingAdapter(Iterable<int[]> tuples, List<E> source)
      Creates an adapter that maps index tuples from tuples to element tuples from source.
      Parameters:
      tuples - an iterable of index arrays (e.g., new Combinations(k, n))
      source - the backing list of elements (size must be n)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if tuples or source is null

  • Method Details

    • iterator

      public Iterator<List<E>> iterator()
      Returns an iterator that lazily maps each int[] to an unmodifiable List<E>.

      Each call to Iterator.next():

      1. Reads the next index array from tuples.
      2. Checks each index for bounds 0 <= i < source.size().
      3. Builds a new ArrayList<E> of the same length and wraps it with Collections.unmodifiableList(List).
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<E>
      Returns:
      iterator over List<E> views of the original index tuples

    • of

      public static <E> IndexingAdapter<E> of(Iterable<int[]> tuples, List<E> source)
      Convenience factory to improve type inference in call sites.
      Type Parameters:
      E - element type
      Parameters:
      tuples - iterable of index arrays
      source - backing list of elements
      Returns:
      a new IndexingAdapter<E>
